text.content: Glad to see you want to attend HackTheU! This application shouldn't take more than 10 minutes. If you need multiple sittings to complete it, complete what you can and submit it. You will be able to edit your application after submission until the application due date.
You must be a matriculated student at a university or have graduated from one in the last 12 months to attend this event.
This is used for verification of information, analysis, and potential job opportunities from our sponsors. This resume doesn't have to be complete or up-to-date, just whatever is on hand!
This is in case of an emergency.
Interested in hosting a workshop at the event? Fill out this form: https://forms.gle/EhsnkwpJQEBA95NA8
Interested in hosting a interest group at the event? Fill out this form: https://forms.gle/1MUKyFASHcapgkrT6
By submitting your application, you agree to allow HackTheU to share your registration information with our sponsors.

text.content: Mentors will float around the hacker space answering questions our participants may have with their projects, such as with debugging or how to use some API. We will have a help queue software to quickly and easily match mentors with participants.

text.content: Note: opening ceremonies will begin at approximately 12 PM on Saturday, Oct 5 and closing ceremonies will end at approximately 4 PM on Sunday, Oct 6th. Registration begins at 10 AM on Saturday, Oct 5.

questions.name: hazard-acknowledgement
questions.label:
Do you acknowledge that the use of any hardware or tools that may pose a fire, electrical, or physical risk to you and/or others is prohibited at this event?
This includes but is not limited to soldering irons, power tools, and high-capacity/unprotected batteries. Please email info@hacktheu.com for any clarifications.

questions.name: hardware
questions.label:
Will your project involve hardware?
Hardware projects are not required for this event!
We will have a booth where we will lend Arduinos; a breadboard; simple components like resistors, LEDs, transistors, capacitors, and buttons.
You are allowed to bring any of your own hardware to this event, like old alarm clocks, Raspberry Pis, motors, etc.
